report_title: Assurance Review: P2P Lifecycle & Vendor Management
executive_summary: The objective of this review was to evaluate the design and operating effectiveness of internal controls governing the Procure-to-Pay (P2P) cycle. Following the migration to a new ERP system in Q1, management requested a review of vendor onboarding and payment authorization workflows, covering transactions from January 1, 2023, to September 30, 2023, with a focus on vendor master data and high-value purchase orders.

details.observation: Inadequate Vendor Due Diligence: A review of 50 new vendors revealed that 12 did not have verified Tax ID numbers or evidence of Conflict of Interest (COI) disclosures on file.
details.risk: Potential for onboarding fraudulent entities, financial penalties from tax authorities, or undisclosed related-party transactions.
details.recommendation: Mandatory validation fields must be enabled in the ERP system to prevent vendor creation without verified tax documentation and digital COI sign-off.

details.observation: Fragmentation of Purchase Orders (Split POs): We identified 15 instances where multiple purchase orders were issued to the same vendor on the same day for values just below the $50,000 threshold requiring Executive VP approval.
details.risk: Circumvention of the Delegation of Authority (DoA) policy, leading to unauthorized spend and lack of executive oversight.
details.recommendation: Implement system-based alerts for aggregate daily spend by vendor and perform monthly forensic data analytics to identify potential DoA bypass patterns.

recommendations: System Controls: Enforce mandatory documentation fields for all new vendor registrations.
Compliance Monitoring: Establish a monthly ‘Spend Exception Report’ to be reviewed by the Finance Director.
Training: Re-train procurement officers on the updated Delegation of Authority (DoA) limits.
management_action_plan: ERP Validation Logic Update | IT Systems Manager | Dec 15, 2023
DoA Refresher Workshop | Compliance Officer | Nov 30, 2023
Monthly Exception Reporting | Procurement Controller | Jan 1, 2024
